intro: Kaukenia elata, commonly known as the tall kaukenia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range from yellow to orange in color. Kaukenia elata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
